title: Japanese Mushroom Noodle Soup
instructions:
1. Break noodles in half; cook according to package directions. Meanwhile, in large saucepan, heat chile oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, garlic and ginger; cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add broth, mirin and soy sauce; bring to a boil. Simmer, uncovered, 10 minutes, stirring once.
  2. Drain noodles, stir into soup. Stir in green onions and sesame oil. Ladle into shallow soup bowls.

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup Mirin (sweet Japanese cooking 1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce or 1/2 cup green onion thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.name: mirin

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2Drain noodles, stir into soup. Stir in green onions and sesame oil. Ladle into shallow soup bowls.
extendedIngredients.name: noodles

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 can reduced sodium beef broth (14.5 oz) or Orienta
extendedIngredients.name: reduced sodium beef broth

extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces shiitake mushrooms dried or fresh if dried, rehydrate before using stems disca
extendedIngredients.name: shiitake mushrooms

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 teaspoons hot chile oil or 2 tsp vegetable oil plus ½
extendedIngredients.name: chile oil
